result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 30, 2022 at 11:15 am.

10:30 am cases 21CF146, 21CM87, 21CM321, 22CF795, 22CF826 called and held via Zoom. Defendant Skipper D Johnson appeared by video, in custody from the Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video for Skipper D Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense needs to address the preliminary hearings in the felony files. 
22CF826: Court notes the amended criminal complaint. New counts apply to the co defendant. 
All files scheduled for 11/30/22 at 11:15 am via Zoom with Judge Barna. 
22CF795 and 22CF826: Preliminary hearings.
Misdemeanor files: Status Conference. 
21CF146:  Arraignment
Return on warrant on October 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:16 PM cases 21CF146, 21CM87, 21CM321, 22CF795, 22CF826 called. Defendant Skipper D Johnson not in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video for Skipper D Johnson.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defense has no information as to the non appearance. State requests a warrant in all files- So ordered.
Status conference on September 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

(Cases called at 8:34 AM - 21CF146, 21CM87, 21CM321, 22CF795, 22CF826)
No appearance by Defendant Skipper D Johnson.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appears in the office of Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick, who appears for the State of Wisconsin. All parties for this hearing appear via Zoom videoconference. 
State requests for an adjournment due to some of these cases having been transferred to Judge Barna (notice of the Zoom hearing may not have been forwarded to the Defendant)
Hearing: September 29, 2022 at 1:00 PM (via Zoom)
